attributes.short_header: Beginning on Mon, May 1, 2017, access to the east entrance of N Station will be through a covered walkway
attributes.header: Beginning on Monday, May 1, 2017, access to the east entrance of North Station will be through a covered walkway. Legends way will be closed to pedestrian access.
attributes.description: Customers are advised that on Monday, May 1, 2017, the pedestrian route for customers transferring from the Green and Orange Line exits at Causeway and Beverly St into North Station Commuter Rail will be moved slightly to accommodate ongoing construction work. After crossing Causeway St, pedestrians will use a protected walkway along the east side of Legends Way, directly abutting Portal Park. The walkway will include a barrier and kick-plate for blind and low vision passengers.

attributes.short_header: Beginning Monday, June 12, the pedestrian walkway near Kendall/MIT Station (inbound) will be closed due to MIT construction.
attributes.header: Beginning Monday, June 12, the pedestrian walkway near Kendall/MIT Station (inbound) will be closed due to MIT construction.
attributes.description:
Access to the Kendall/MIT Station will remain open and accessible on the Main Street side of the station throughout this construction.
 
The pedestrian plaza between Carleton Street and Main Street in Kendall Square will be closed due to the construction of an underground garage. 
 
Customers are encouraged to utilize alternative paths to/from the station using the paths on Ames Street, Dock Street, or Wadsworth Street.

Affected routes:
Red Line

attributes.short_header: Elevator 804 PARK STREET - Tremont Street to the Lobby will be reconstructed and will be out of service through June 2017.
attributes.header: Elevator 804 PARK STREET - Tremont Street to the Lobby will be reconstructed and will be out of service through June 2017.
attributes.description: If entering the station, cross Tremont Street to the Boston Common and use Park Street Elevator 978 to the Green Line westbound platform. Red Line platform access is available via the elevator beyond the fare gates. If exiting the station, please travel down the Winter Street Concourse toward Downtown Crossing Station, exit through the fare gates, and take Downtown Crossing Elevator 892 to the street level.

attributes.description: If exiting, return to the fare lobby to use North Station Elevator 912 (lobby to Causeway Street) or pass through the fare gates, walk the full length of the Green Line platform to use North Station Elevator 909 (lobby to Valenti Way). attributes.short_header: Due to rail tie replacement on the Worcester Line btwn Wellesley Farms & Westboro, mid-day trains Mon-Fri may experience delays of 5-15 min
attributes.header: Due to the necessary replacement of railroad ties on the Worcester Line between Wellesley Farms & Westborough, weekday Worcester Line trains may experience delays of 5-15 minutes in both directions between 8:30 am and 4:00 pm.
attributes.description: Additionally, peak hour trains may see minor delays due to speed restrictions around construction zones.  Replacement of railroad ties is expected to be completed by the first week of June.

attributes.short_header: Lechmere Station Parking Lot will close permanently at 6:00 pm on Thursday, June 22 due to the Green Line extension project.
attributes.header: Lechmere Station Parking Lot will close permanently at 6:00 pm on Thursday, June 22 due to the Green Line extension project.
attributes.description:
This lot is permanently closing to accommodate infrastructure for the Green Line extension and development in the North Point area.

Any vehicles remaining in the lot after 6:00 pm on Thursday, June 22, will be towed.

Affected routes:
Green Line E branch

attributes.short_header: Please board all trains on the inbound platforms at Haverhill & Bradford except Trains 216 & 222
attributes.header: Please board all trains on the inbound platforms at Haverhill and Bradford except Trains 216 (1:35 pm from Haverhill) and 222 (6:09 pm from Haverhill).
attributes.description:
Due to the Merrimack River Bridge project, trains that operate between Bradford and Haverhill will only use the inbound track. Trains that are bused between Haverhill and Bradford will board on the outbound platform at Bradford for service into Boston. Note: Train 216 (1:35 pm from Haverhill) and Train 222 (6:09 pm from Haverhill) are bused from Haverhill Station to Bradford Station. The outbound platform at Bradford may be accessed via the crossing that is south (to the right when facing the tracks from the parking lot) of the mini-high platforms. Alternatively, the outbound platform can also be accessed via the sidewalk from Laurel Avenue.


Affected stops:
Bradford
Haverhill

attributes.short_header: Starting 6/3, all weekend Fairmount Line trains will be bused between Morton St. & Readville due to construction of Blue Hill Ave Station.
attributes.header: Starting 6/3, all weekend Fairmount Line trains will be bused between Morton St. and Readville in both directions due to construction of the new Blue Hill Avenue Station.
attributes.description:
Starting Saturday, June 3rd, major construction of the brand new, fully accessible Blue Hill Avenue Station on the Fairmount Line will take place on weekends and in the evening weekday hours for up to twenty-four months. 

During this time, all weekend Fairmount Line trains will be bused between Morton Street and Readville in both directions.  

A schedule will be put into effect, effective June 3rd, to account for busing, and is available on the Fairmount Line schedule page on mbta.com.

Affected stops:
Morton Street
Fairmount
Readville

attributes.short_header: Starting 6/5, the last 2 weekday outb. Fairmount Ln trains, 787 & 789 will be replaced by buses due to construction of the new Blue Hill Ave
attributes.header: Starting 6/5, the last 2 weekday outbound Fairmount Line trains, 787 (10:00 pm outbound) and 789 (11:00 pm outbound) will be replaced by buses due to construction of the new Blue Hill Avenue Station.
attributes.description:
Starting Saturday, June 3rd, major construction of the brand new, fully accessible Blue Hill Avenue Station on the Fairmount Line will take place on weekends and in the evening weekday hours for up to twenty-four months. 

During this time, the last two weeknight outbound Fairmount Line trains from South Station will be replaced with dedicated shuttle buses serving all stops between South Station and Readville.

A schedule will be put into effect, effective June 3rd, to account for busing, and is available on the Fairmount Line schedule page on mbta.com.

attributes.short_header: Newburyport/Rockport weekend bus schedule information is now available online for passengers affected by weekend Positive Trn Control instal
attributes.header: Newburyport/Rockport weekend bus schedule information is now available online for passengers affected by weekend Positive Train Control installation from July 8 - September 30.
attributes.description:
The MBTA will install federally mandated Positive Train Control (PTC) systems along the Newburyport/Rockport Line to improve safety by reducing train collisions and derailments. This work will require weekend shutdowns on the entire line from July 8 through September 30, with buses servicing the following stations:

Newburyport Line  Newburyport, Ipswich, Beverly Depot, Salem, and North Station

Rockport Line  Rockport, Gloucester, Manchester-by-the-Sea, Beverly Depot, Salem, and North Station

During this time, the special weekend fare will be $10 roundtrip, and Zone 3 or higher monthly passes will be accepted. Additionally, parking will be free at Newburyport, Ipswich, Rockport, Gloucester, and Manchester-by-the-Sea.

Detailed information, as well as the weekend diversion schedule with bus times, can be viewed by clicking on the banner on mbta.com.

Affected stops:
Beverly
Ipswich
Manchester
Newburyport
Gloucester
Rockport

attributes.short_header: d Newburyport/Rockport alternate transportation information is now available online for passengers affected by the replacement of the Beverl
attributes.header: Updated Newburyport/Rockport alternate transportation information is now available online for passengers affected by the replacement of the Beverly Drawbridge from July 17 - August 13.
attributes.description:
Construction on the Beverly Drawbridge is scheduled from July 17 to August 13. During this time, there will be no train service north of Salem Station, but the MBTA has posted alternate transportation options as well as a schedule for a free weekday shuttle bus to Salem Station from Newburyport, Ipswich, Rockport, Gloucester, Manchester-by-the-Sea, or Beverly Depot.

During the entire months of July and August, Zone 3 monthly passes will be accepted on the entire Newburyport/Rockport Line. Additionally, parking will be free at Newburyport, Ipswich, Rockport, Gloucester, and Manchester-by-the-Sea stations.

Detailed information, as well as the weekday diversion schedule with bus times, can be viewed by clicking on the Newburyport/Rockport Line homepage banner on mbta.com.

Affected stops:
Beverly
Ipswich
Manchester
Newburyport
Gloucester
Rockport

attributes.short_header: Buses will replace Green Line D service between Reservoir and Riverside on the weekends of Jun 24 - 25 and Jul 1 - 2, due to track work
attributes.header: Buses will replace Green Line D branch service between Reservoir and Riverside Stations on the weekends of June 24 - 25 and July 1 - 2, due to track work.
attributes.description:
Due to necessary track work, buses will replace Riverside branch service between Reservoir and Riverside Stations on the following weekends from start to end of service:

- Saturday, June 24, 2017 and Sunday, June 25, 2017
- Saturday, July 1, 2017 and Sunday, July 2, 2017

Regular Green D branch service will resume at the start of service on the following Monday.  All shuttle bus stops are accessible for persons with disabilities. 
 
Shuttling the following stops:
Reservoir
Chestnut Hill
Newton Centre
Newton Highlands
Eliot
Waban
Woodland
Riverside

attributes.short_header: Prov. side pedestrian bridge work at Canton Jct. is experiencing unexpected construction delays. Visit mbta.com/alerts for more info.
attributes.header: The Providence side of the pedestrian bridge at Canton Junction is closed for repairs, requiring a 10-15 minute detour around the station to access other platforms.
attributes.description:
The pedestrian bridge work is experiencing unexpected construction delays.  The Engineering team is actively working to resolve these issues, and a new update will be posted as soon as possible.

During construction, the station will remain fully accessible and mini-high platforms will remain open. 

Access between Platform A (Providence outbound) and B/C/D (Providence inbound/Stoughton outbound/Stoughton inbound) will require a 10-15 minute walking detour around the station. This means, for example, passengers who take an inbound Providence or Stoughton train, but park on the outbound Providence side, will need an additional 10-15 minutes in the morning to access their platform via the sidewalk to the bridge at Spaulding Street.

The first phase, which repaired the Stoughton side of the pedestrian bridge, is complete.

Passengers should consider which trains they take and plan accordingly based on whether they intend to follow the detour during their morning or evening commute.

attributes.short_header: Access to the east entrance of North Station is available through a covered walkway. Legends Way is closed to pedestrian access.
attributes.service_effect: Green Line and Orange Line notice
attributes.header: Access to the east entrance of North Station is available through a covered walkway. Legends Way is closed to pedestrian access.
attributes.description:
Customers are advised that the pedestrian route for customers transferring from the Green and Orange Line exits at Causeway and Beverly St into North Station Commuter Rail will be moved slightly to accommodate ongoing construction work. 
After crossing Causeway St, pedestrians will use a protected walkway along the east side of Legends Way, directly abutting Portal Park. The walkway will include a barrier and kick-plate for blind and low vision passengers.
As an alternative, customers may consider utilizing the west exit from North Station Commuter Rail due to congestion.
